name: Bael Tea Recipe (Nam Matoom)
description: This bael fruit tea recipe is known as nam matoom in Thailand. It's quick and easy to make, perfect for a refreshing or warm drink.
recipeIngredient: 3.5 ounces natural cane sugar (add to taste)

recipeInstructions.text: In a medium pot, bring water to a simmer over medium heat. Add in your bael fruit slices and let them cook for 20 minutes to release their flavors.
recipeInstructions.name: In a medium pot, bring water to a simmer over medium heat. Add in your bael fruit slices and let them cook for 20 minutes to release their flavors.

recipeInstructions.text: Stir in the sugar and salt until the sugar completely dissolved. Give it a taste and add more sugar if you like it sweeter.
recipeInstructions.name: Stir in the sugar and salt until the sugar completely dissolved. Give it a taste and add more sugar if you like it sweeter.

recipeInstructions.text: Use a strainer to pour the bael juice into your favorite tea cup for a warm drink, or over a tall glass filled with ice for a cool refreshment. Enjoy!
